page.title: 10Chinley Station
page.content: Chinley Railway station was once one of the main stations along the Manchester to Sheffield line. It used to have six platforms in those days, but now it has only two. Not so many people use the station now and hardly anyone stays at the Prince's Hotel, built during the boom years of the railway. Passenger trains are now few and far between, though there are ICI wagons which use the track quite often, carrying limestone from the quarries. Not so long ago the Flying Scotsman came along the line with some other old steam trains. When this happens, people line the route just to catch a glimpse of these engines and many bring cameras and tape recorders, to record the sights and sounds. by{Richard Edwards
